meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children managed to begrime their clothes with mud.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic's hands were begrimed with grease after fixing the car.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to begrime the freshly washed floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: Her once pristine white dress was now begrimed beyond recognition after the food fight.
meanings.sent5: The old abandoned house was so begrimed that it looked haunted.

meanings.sent1: The begrimed windows of the old house obscured the view inside.
meanings.sent2: The begrimed walls of the tunnel made it feel eerie and unwelcoming.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the begrimed car just wouldn't shine like new.
meanings.sent4: The begrimed streets of the city gave it a gritty, urban feel.
meanings.sent5: The begrimed dishes in the sink made her cringe at the thought of washing them.
